Title:
Asproinocybaceae fam. nov. (Agaricales, Agaricomycetes) for
accommodating the genera Asproinocybe and Tricholosporum, and
description of Asproinocybe sinensis and Tricholosporum guangxiense sp.
nov.
Keywords:
ITS + nLSU + RPB1+RPB2 + SSU + TEF1-Î±; new taxa;
phylogeny; taxonomy; karst areas; Tri-cholomataceae
Abstract:
The species from Asproinocybe and Tricholosporum is little
to know, and the placement at family level still unsolved. In this
study, we conducted molecular phylogenetic analyses based on nuc rDNA
internal transcribed spacer region (ITS) + nuc 28S rDNA (nrLSU) and a
six genes [ITS, LSU, RNA polymerase II largest subunit (RPB1), RNA
polymerase II second largest subunit (RPB2), 18S nuclear small subunit
ribosomal DNA (nrSSU), translation elongation factor 1-alpha (TEF)]
dataset using Bayesian (BA) and Maximum Likelihood (ML) methods showed
that the species of Asproinocybe and Tricholosporum form an independent
family-level clade (BPP=0.98, BS=72). Asproinocybaceae fam. nov., a new
family is established here for accommodating this clade. Two new species
Asproinocybe sinensis and Tricholosporum guangxiense from subtropical
karst areas of China also describe here.
